One new development, Simon Munzu explained, is the emergence of groups of youths determined to enforce the civil disobedience campaign recently waged by Alassane Ouattara 's camp by setting up roadblocks, burning tyres, obstructing traffic generally, and threatening to use physical violence against those who appear not to want to heed the call to disobedience.`` While we condemn human rights infringements committed by the defence and security forces of Laurent Gbagbo, we can not turn a blind eye to the increasingly serious violations of economic, social and cultural rights that result from the forcible enforcement of the call to civil disobedience that has been issued by the Alassane Ouattara camp, he added.
